attributes.action: to actively encourage the playing of Cricket at all Schools, Colleges and Universities, allow the giving away of free tickets to County, 20/20 and Test Matches, to all Schools, Colleges and Univerisities. Allow free or significantly discounted tickets for all matches to be given away to people earning less than £25k per year, and Families receiving an annual income of less than £40k per year.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We feel that actively encouraging the game of Cricket will encourage good values, due to the games history of fairness, and the exceptional ways in which the majority of cricketers conduct themselves, both on and off the field.

Cricket has always been entrenced in good strong social, moral, and family values, and has always been exceptional at binding local communities together, free from racial, religious and class prejudice. 

We feel now, that this is more essential then ever, as we are living in troubled times of violence, family and social breakdown, and also in a time, when more than ever, children and young adults are carrying weapons, with the intention to use them, to mutilate or murder another human being, or to defend themselves against attack, from those intending to harm.

Cricket binds communties together, and allows people from all generations to socialise, enjoy themselves, and share space, in a a sporting and social experience that is truly enjoyable.
